item.title: Josphat Kinyumu
item.dc:creator: Linus Chirchir
item.description:
Josphat Kinyumu is a skilled professional with many years of experience in technology risk and IT audits. He has worked with well-known companies in the UK and East Africa, helping businesses in industries like banking, energy, insurance, manufacturing, and telecom stay secure and meet regulations.

💼 Professional Journey

Josphat currently works at Aberdeen as an IT Internal Audit Manager, where he looks after technology risks, IT controls, and how well systems are managed within one of the UK’s top financial firms.

His career started at PwC East Africa, where he joined as a graduate trainee and later led tech audits for some of Kenya’s biggest banks and insurance firms helping them meet regulatory standards.

He later moved to the UK to work at KPMG, spending several years as a Manager in External Audit, leading IT audit work for major clients. After that, he joined Forvis Mazars, where he headed a team of IT audit specialists focused on banking clients.

🌍 Thought Leadership & Contributions

Across roles, Josphat has been a trusted voice on aligning IT systems with financial reporting and compliance objectives. He has contributed to tech-enabled audit transformation, supported diversity initiatives, and mentored emerging professionals with a focus on clarity, growth, and inclusiveness. His interest in bridging technology and governance continues to fuel meaningful dialogue and collaborative learning, especially within multicultural and cross-functional teams.

🎓 Education & Qualifications

Josphat’s education gives him a strong mix of tech know-how and business understanding:

  • Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)
  • Certified Public Accountant (CPA)
  • BSc in Computer Science, First Class Honours, University of Nairobi

💬 In His Words

“Audit isn’t just about spotting problems. It’s about building trust, improving systems, and helping others feel confident. I love learning, and every project gives me a chance to help connect technology with smart decision-making.”

item.title: Dr. Kamau Wairuri
item.dc:creator: Linus Chirchir
item.description:
Dr. Kamau Wairuri is a Kenyan political scientist, policy-oriented researcher, educator, and thought leader with a passion for democracy, human rights, and inclusive governance. His work focuses on policing, violence, and the experiences of marginalised communities in Africa.

🎓 Academic Background

Dr. Wairuri holds:

  • PhD in African Studies, University of Edinburgh
  • MSc in African Studies, University of Oxford
  • BA in Political Science and Sociology, University of Nairobi

His academic journey reflects a deep commitment to interrogating systems of power, security, and social justice in Africa.

🔍 Research Focus

Kamau’s research is widely respected and centres around:

  • Politics of state policing, police abuse, reform, and accountability
  • Policing of marginalised, stigmatised, and criminalised groups
  • Violence, including political violence, terrorism, and urban crime

His scholarship has been published in leading journals such as African Affairs and Africa, and edited volumes like the Routledge Handbook for the Horn of Africa. He currently co-edits a book project on migration and marginalisation in East Africa.

He is an active member of professional networks, including:

  • British Institute in Eastern Africa (BIEA)
  • African Studies Association (UK)
  • Development Studies Association (UK)

👨🏽‍🏫 Educator & Mentor

Dr. Wairuri is currently a Lecturer in Criminology at Edinburgh Napier University, where he teaches undergraduate and postgraduate courses on policing and transnational crime. He also leads the Institute of Public Policy and Governance (IPPG) at Strathmore University Business School, Nairobi.

He has delivered lectures and seminars at prestigious institutions including:

  • University of Oxford
  • University of Cambridge
  • University of Strathclyde

He is also an Associate Fellow of the Higher Education Academy (UK).

🧭 Policy & Public Engagement

As a policy and public affairs consultant, Dr. Wairuri has advised organisations and leaders on:

  • Safety and security
  • Gender inclusion and equity
  • Human rights mainstreaming
  • Youth empowerment

His work in this space has been captured in technical reports and policy briefs.

🗞️ Public Thought Leadership

Kamau is a regular contributor to public debates on governance and social justice. His articles have appeared in:

  • Daily Nation, The Standard (as a former columnist), and The East African
  • African Arguments and The Elephant

He is the host of The Kenyanist, a podcast exploring the political and social issues affecting Kenyans today.

💬 In His Words

“Scholarship should serve society – through truth, clarity, and the courage to challenge injustice.”

item.title: Louis Kimanzi
item.dc:creator: Linus Chirchir
item.description:
Louis Kimanzi is a conscientious individual who believes in the power of sport as a catalyst for positive change - both globally and locally. With a passion for building communities and unlocking opportunities through sport, Louis exemplifies leadership and vision in both academic and professional arenas.

🎓 Academic Achievements

Louis graduated with First Class Honours from the University of Edinburgh, earning a Bachelor of Science in Applied Sports Science. His academic excellence was matched by his active contribution to advancing sports knowledge, especially with a focus on Kenyan athletes.

📊 Research & Innovation

Louis was the lead researcher in a pioneering investigation on the role of carbon fibre shoes in running performance. Collaborating with:

  • Kenya Academy of Sport
  • Enda Sportswear
  • Lornah Kiplagat High Altitude Training Center
  • University of Edinburgh (funder)

This groundbreaking research led to the publication of a journal article titled:

“The effect of carbon-fibre insoles on the running economy of elite Kenyan athletes”

It stands out as one of the first biomechanics studies conducted in Kenya using local elite athletes, Kenyan-made shoes, and research led by a Kenyan scientist.

🌍 Global Dialogue & Impact

In 2023, Louis presented at the Kenya Academy of Sport’s 2nd International Sports Conference, where he spoke on:

“Investing in sports infrastructure, equipment, and technology in Kenya.”

His insights drew from both his scientific background and personal commitment to elevating sport as a development tool in Africa.

💼 Professional Life

Louis currently works as a Product Owner at FanDuel Ltd, a global sports technology giant. His role blends strategic leadership with a deep understanding of user needs in high-performance environments.

🎯 Continuing Education

He is presently pursuing a Master of Science in Sports Policy, Management, and International Development of Sport, with a vision to acquire the tools necessary to shape sustainable sports systems in Kenya and beyond.

💬 Personal Philosophy

“Sport is not just a game. It’s a platform for empowerment, identity, and transformation.”

item.title: Linus Chirchir
item.dc:creator: Linus Chirchir
item.description:
Linus Chirchir is a passionate data scientist based in Edinburgh and a founding force behind the Kenyan Community in Scotland website. With over a decade of experience in health information systems, research, and analytics, Linus has dedicated his career to driving data-informed decisions that make a real-world impact.

💼 Professional Journey

Originally from Kenya, Linus worked at Moi Teaching and Referral Hospital where he managed integrated health information systems and supported research and analytics. After completing his MSc in Health Data Science at Swansea University, he joined the University of Edinburgh as a Health Data Analyst.

Currently, he works at Research Data Scotland (RDS) as a Data Analyst, where he prepares ADR Scotland datasets for integration into Scotland’s National Safe Haven. His work includes data cleaning, transformation, anonymisation, quality assessment, documentation, and collaboration with cross-functional teams.

He specialises in:

  • Synthetic data generation
  • Reproducible analytical pipelines (RAP)
  • GIS and public health data visualisation
  • Ethical AI and open science
  • R, SQL, Quarto, and Shiny app development

Linus finds purpose in applying technical expertise to real-world datasets that inform impactful research and policy.

🏙️ Life in Edinburgh

Since moving to Scotland, Linus has been deeply engaged in local and national community-building. Whether he’s coordinating Munro climbs, organising community mixers, or mentoring students, he fosters unity and wellness through action.

He believes in the power of shared experiences, storytelling, and open conversations - often over a hike or meal - to strengthen community bonds.

💬 In His Words

“Data is more than numbers, it’s about people, equity, and opportunity. And community gives our work meaning.”

🎓 Education

  • MSc in Health Data Science, Swansea University
  • Master of Business Administration, United States International University – Africa
  • Master of Information Systems, Kisii University
  • Bachelor of Business Management (Business Information Systems Management), Moi University

✨ Highlights & Reflections

  • Professional Highlight: Working with interdisciplinary teams at RDS to enable safe, ethical access to administrative data and support data-driven research.
  • Professional Challenge: Keeping pace with evolving best practices and technologies in large-scale data environments — addressed through ongoing learning and collaboration.
  • Inspiration: Hans Rosling — his data storytelling approach transformed Linus’ view of analytics as a force for good.
  • Advice That Stuck: “Stay curious and keep learning.” Change, as Heraclitus said, is the only constant — and Linus embraces it as an opportunity to grow.
  • Fun Fact: His Mastermind subject would be Olympic Marathon Champions (1960–2024).
